Personal Skills

1. Communication

I consistently communicate with the CEO to ensure the app meets the needs of our target users, especially since it is crucial to understand whether the design is suitable for teenagers. Clear and frequent communication helps ensure that the app’s features align with the organization’s objectives.

2. Time Management

With weekly meetings every Friday, I am able to stay on track with the development timeline. I effectively manage my time to make sure the app design is adjusted according to feedback, and the timeline is adhered to without delays.

3. Self-Learning

I utilized AppSheet to develop the app, which was a new platform for me. To effectively use it, I took the initiative to learn its features through additional research and tutorials, demonstrating my ability to adapt to new tools and technologies.

4. Problem Solving

I encountered several design challenges, such as ensuring the system automatically sends an email to users once they complete their certification. I resolved these issues by researching and implementing solutions that automate the process, ensuring the system functions smoothly.

5. Innovation

I strive to incorporate innovation into my design process. Beyond meeting the basic requirements, I introduced interactive elements that make learning about marine conservation more engaging and enjoyable for students. This not only improves the educational experience but also increases user engagement.

Project: Youth Marine Conservation App

This app was designed to educate students on marine conservation and global warming. I was responsible for designing the app’s UI, creating learning modules, quizzes, and implementing features like certificate generation. The app’s design emphasizes user engagement with interactive features and smooth navigation. It also includes social sharing capabilities to increase visibility and encourage further participation.
